title: Patel breaks with Trump on clemency for Jan. 6 violence against officers
shortDescription: FBI director nominee Kash Patel broke with President Donald Trump over commuting sentences for Jan. 6, 2021 violence against law enforcement.

title: Trump and his allies say DEI was a factor in DC plane crash
shortDescription: Trump on Thursday criticized hiring practices of his predecessor that promoted diversity, equity and inclusion.

title: Trump blames Army helicopter in fatal crash with airliner
shortDescription: President Donald Trump blamed the Army helicopter in the fatal crash for flying at the same height at an American Airlines plane.

title: Stefanik, Trump's pick for U.N. ambassador, advances to floor vote
shortDescription: The Senate Foreign Relations Committe voted on Thursday to move forward New York Rep. Elise Stefanik for a floor vote.

title: 'NOT GOOD!': Trump brings unusual approach to plane crash in first big crisis
shortDescription: Two weeks into his presidency, Trump faced a major crisis with the plane crash near DCA. He brought his unconventional style to the matter

title: Kennedy, Patel and Gabbard: Trump picks face high-stakes hearings. Live
shortDescription: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., Tulsi Gabbard and Kash Patel are each set to appear before lawmakers during a pivotal day of confirmation hearings Thursday.

title: Trump axed help for tribal and Hispanic colleges. They’re not happy.
shortDescription: President Trump rescinded Biden-era executive orders that bolstered support for tribal colleges and universities with the most Hispanic students.

title: Senators ask Kash Patel about pursuing Trump's enemies, FBI's future
shortDescription: President Trump’s pick for FBI director, Kash Patel, faces a blockbuster confirmation hearing Thursday.

title: How an emergent Catholic right is poised to shape Trump's second term
shortDescription: With Vice President JD Vance and other allies in power, an emergent Catholic right expands political horizons and raises doubts about church unity.

title: Trump to cancel student visas of pro-Palestinian protesters
shortDescription: Civil rights groups and legal scholars said the new measure would violate constitutional free speech rights and would likely draw legal challenges.

title: Trump wants to send unauthorized migrants to Gitmo
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says to house up to 30,000 unauthorized migrants at Guantanamo Bay for being in the U.S illegally.

title: Read the Laken Riley Act, the law signed by President Trump on Wednesday
shortDescription: The legislation will require immigration officers to detain immigrants who are in the U.S. illegally when they're accused of lower-level crimes like shoplifting.

title: Trump foreign aid order not tied to US disaster aid | fact check
shortDescription: Trump signed an executive order to pause foreign development aid. The order doesn't mention Florida, North Carolina, Tennessee or California.

title: Trump says he'll halt funds to schools that 'indoctrinate' students
shortDescription: President Donald Trump issued an order Wednesday saying he would divert federal funds from schools teaching "discriminatory equity ideology."

title: Trump appeals NY hush money guilty verdict. What will he argue?
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump formally appealed his New York felony conviction, jumpstarting his latest fight to get the guilty verdict thrown out.

title: White House rescinds memo freezing federal funding
shortDescription: The Trump administration has rescinded a memo to freeze federal funding across all agencies, which critics call unconstitutional.

title: Trump signs executive order bolstering school choice
shortDescription: President Donald Trump on Wednesday signed an executive order directing federal agencies to find ways to favor school choice programs.

title: Trump sued over alleged effort to hire 'unqualified political flunkies'
shortDescription: The largest union for government employees sued the Trump administration to block an executive order that strips federal workers of job protections.

title: Senate confirms Lee Zeldin as EPA administrator
shortDescription: Zeldin, 44, is from New York. He served eight years in Congress and lost a race for governor in 2022. He is expected to push deregulation.
